column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r221422142315\r\r1\r254263273\r\r2\r273264263\r\r3\r274264264\r\r4\r28332213221\r\r5\r29132933221\r\r6\r212325232023\r\rOther**\r7161\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement5 days5 days5 days\r\rProfessional development is ongoing to keep the Clovis Elementary teachers abreast of new learning strat-egies
column3: innovative teaching techniques and\rapplied technology in the field of education. Weekly planning opportunities are provided for teachers on Wednesday early release days to coordinate\rand plan lessons or units as an entire grade level. In addition
column4: site funding is provided for teachers to take additional planning days to spend time looking\rover new ELA curriculum and other resources to better meet the needs of our students. Teachers will continue to receive training in the areas of math
column6: diversity training and working with problematic students. The Second Step Curriculum was purchased through a grant that was written in\rJune. A presentation on the curriculum was held in October for parents. The staff is very excited about the implementation of this curriculum.\r\rTeachers also share research-based teaching strategies that will assist all students in making academic growth during Professional Learning Community\r(PLC) meetings. These weekly planning meetings assist with closely monitoring student growth. Instructional adjustments can be made to ensure teachers\rare provid-ing a challenging curriculum for those students excelling and provide support to those students struggling academically. Additionally
column8: and Action Plans are developed to assist students. These Action Plans are then implemented and revisited every quarter.\rFor the 2018-19 school year
column9: teachers will focus on one Essential Standard in math and ELA. Teachers will write assessments and have PLC meet-ings to\rlook over data and adjust their instruction where necessary. Mastery of the Essential Standard in ELA and math will assist all our students on the SBAC\rand district assessments. Building strategies and stamina at every grade level in the areas of math word problems and reading with justification will also\rsupport our students on the end of year assessments.\r\rTeachers acquire new knowledge through district workshops
column12: district personnel and\rconferences. Teachers are supported through principal observations and feedback. Clovis Elementary students continue to show academic progress due\rto our staff training. For-mal Progress Monitoring meetings are held twice a year with teachers and administration to review student assessment data.\rInformal meetings are held throughout the year. These meetings help to keep us focused on the academic progress of all students and target areas of\rconcern.\r\rParents are welcome to observe classroom instruction anytime
